https://studio.code.org/s/hourofcode/sta.short_instructions: Acorn! Acorn! Acorn! Use an "if" block to get me there with the fewest number of blocks.
Ok, let's do that again for practice - this isn't very different, but watch out for the wall!
The "If-else" blocks checks a condition, and then does one thing OR another. To get me to the acorn try to use this new block.
One more practice of the "if-else" block, can you get it right on your first try?
Can you add just 3 blocks to help me solve a more complex maze? If you do it right, I can walk any curvy path no matter the length. Hurry! The ice is melting!
